private_information: I specialize in turning natural-language task descriptions into a precise, lossless, machine-readable planning model.
I extract objects, predicates, action schemata, initial states, goals, and any candidate plans provided.
I do not emit PDDL; I produce a clean intermediate JSON model for downstream agents.
facts_analyst.goal: Produce a normalized, unambiguous model of the environment and both scenarios from the public information.

private_information: I transform extracted facts into canonical operator schemata with clearly named parameters, preconditions, and effects.
I ensure predicate arities, argument orders, and action signatures are consistent across the model.
I do not emit PDDL; I output a refined intermediate action schema and a typed object list.
action_modeler.goal: Refine the extracted model into a canonical, solver-ready intermediate schema without generating PDDL.

private_information: I validate or annotate the provided plan for Scenario A using the intermediate model.
I identify causal links, precondition satisfaction, and report any mismatches or necessary clarifications.
I propose a high-level, non-PDDL plan sketch for Scenario B if possible, staying within the given operators.
plan_reviewer.goal: Review and annotate the provided plan for Scenario A and produce actionable notes and a candidate high-level plan for Scenario B.

private_information: I consolidate intermediate models and plan notes to produce the final PDDL artifacts.
I target the FastDownward/FastDownwards solver, ensuring STRIPS-safe domains where applicable.
I keep action names consistent with the use-case and include only grounded objects needed for the selected scenario.
orchestrator.goal: Produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the selected scenario, ready for the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Available actions with signatures: paltry(o0 o1 o2), sip(o0 o1 o2), clip(o0 o1 o2), wretched(o0 o1 o2 o3), memory(o0 o1 o2), tightfisted(o0 o1 o2).
paltry preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2. paltry add effects: next o0 o2. paltry delete effects: vase o0 o1.
sip preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2. sip add effects: vase o0 o1. sip delete effects: next o0 o2.
clip preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2. clip add effects: vase o0 o1. clip delete effects: next o0 o2.
wretched preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3. wretched add effects: next o0 o2. wretched delete effects: next o0 o1.
memory preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1. memory add effects: next o0 o2. memory delete effects: next o0 o1.
tightfisted preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1. tightfisted add effects: next o0 o2. tightfisted delete effects: vase o0 o1.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_3 object_7, next object_4 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario A goal: next object_11 object_10.

Scenario A provided plan (in order): wretched object_3 object_7 object_6 object_1; clip object_11 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_11 object_3 object_5; memory object_0 object_8 object_5; sip object_11 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_8; paltry object_11 object_0 object_8; clip object_11 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_10 object_2; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_10.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, next object_0 object_5, next object_11 object_8, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario B goal: next object_11 object_9.
Notes: All identifiers are constants (object_0 ... object_11). Predicates are unary or binary as written. Effects not listed as add or delete are assumed unchanged (STRIPS-style).

extract.system_prompt: You are an expert in extracting precise planning models from natural descriptions. Build a normalized, lossless JSON model with keys: objects (list), predicates (list of {name, arity, args}), actions (list of {name, parameters, preconditions (list of literals), add_effects, del_effects}), scenarios (list of {name, init (list of grounded literals), goal (list of grounded literals), provided_plan (optional list of grounded actions in order)}). Do not emit PDDL.
extract.prompt: Your name is facts_analyst. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->facts_analyst->private_information} Your task: extract all objects, predicates, action schemata, and both scenarios (A and B) into the requested JSON under <model></model>. Preserve names exactly as given and keep argument ordering consistent with the public information.

schematize.system_prompt: You refine intermediate planning models. Given an extracted model, produce a canonicalized schema: normalize parameter names and orders, ensure consistency across action signatures, and output a JSON with keys: typed_objects, predicate_signatures, operator_schema (name, parameters, pre, add, del), and grounding_guidelines. Do not emit PDDL.
schematize.prompt: Your name is action_modeler. Use the extracted model: {facts_model} Apply consistent parameter naming such as (?a, ?b, ?c, ?d) mapping to positions described in the public information. Output the refined schema under <schema></schema>. Do not change the meaning of any operator or predicate.

review.system_prompt: You analyze plan correctness using preconditions and effects. You do not emit PDDL. Provide a step-by-step causal analysis for Scenario A and, if possible, propose a non-PDDL high-level plan for Scenario B. Flag any mismatches and list required supporting facts that enable each action.
review.prompt: Your name is plan_reviewer. Use the model: {facts_model} and the schema: {action_schema} 1) Validate Scenario A's provided plan, listing for each step the preconditions satisfied and the state updates. 2) Summarize whether the final goal is achieved. 3) Propose a concise high-level action sequence for Scenario B that could achieve its goal, if feasible. Return your analysis under <analysis></analysis>.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-operator PDDL targeting the FastDownward (FastDownwards) solver. Produce one PDDL domain and one PDDL problem that are consistent with the provided operators and Scenario B. Keep operator names exactly as: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Use only the necessary objects. Ensure predicates and effects match the description. Output: enclose the PDDL domain within <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem within <problem></problem>. Do not include explanations outside those tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the extracted model and schema to generate final PDDL for Scenario B. Public information: {environment->public_information} Inputs: {facts_model} {action_schema} {plan_notes} Requirements: - Domain name: logistics19 - Problem name: s2_goal_next_object_11_object_9 - Include :strips and :typing only if needed; keep it STRIPS-compatible. - Objects: include object_0 ... object_11 as needed by Scenario B. - Initial state: exactly the Scenario B initial facts. - Goal: (next object_11 object_9). - Keep predicate names and arities consistent. - Provide domain in <domain></domain> and problem in <problem></problem>.
